top_categories.workout_context: Iron Cross’s pa hills, cyclocross elements demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Iron Cross isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Iron Cross rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Iron Cross when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Iron Cross. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Iron Cross — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Iron Cross’s pa hilly gravel with cyclocross elements and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Iron Cross’s pa hilly gravel with cyclocross elements drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The varied gradients at Iron Cross reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Iron Cross — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on pa hilly gravel with cyclocross elements.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Iron Cross — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Iron Cross count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Iron Cross’s 60 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Iron Cross requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on pa hilly gravel with cyclocross elements to build confidence. Expect: pa hills, cyclocross elements, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 60 miles of pa hilly gravel with cyclocross elements in Pennsylvania.
